intro: Craibiodendron mannii, commonly known as the African violet, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its thick, fleshy leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte or lithophyte, often found on trees or rocks in humid environments. Its flowers, which come in various colors, are pollinated primarily by birds and insects. Craibiodendron mannii is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
